name: sfchronicle
text:
Giants fans should consider themselves fortunate, writes @Bruce_Jenkins1. Among the more cynical insiders, the only National League race worth following is for the No. 8 seed in the playoffs. 

https://t.co/tUcLD67PCH

name: sfchronicle
text:
49ers’ 53-man roster projection by @eric_branch: Dante Pettis, JaMycal Hasty, Darrion Daniels, Johnathan Cyprien make the cut.

https://t.co/BToBrSUUEk

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Francisco’s beloved 20th Century Cafe isn’t just a place for Russian honey cake, pirogi and other Central and Eastern European treats anymore. Owner Michelle Polzine has teamed up with local wine guru Kara Fowler to add a natural wine shop inside.

https://t.co/Uj39STJFw3

name: sfchronicle
text:
President Trump kicks his crime-focused re-election strategy into overdrive Tuesday during a stop in Kenosha, Wis., blaming “domestic terrorists” for the unrest that ensued there after a police officer shot a Black man in the back.

via @JoeGarofoli: https://t.co/uHPo0yTEhg

name: sfchronicle
text:
California will create a new COVID-19 data reporting system that will be more “robust” in handling large numbers of coronavirus cases than the state’s current system, which malfunctioned in July.

Story by @Cat_Ho: https://t.co/E4qQcooAVJ

name: sfchronicle
text: Can’t pay the rent? Here’s how California’s new pandemic eviction law affects you: https://t.co/L3KnuiKVTf

name: sfchronicle
text: Weather forecasts for Labor Day weekend show another heat wave coming to the Bay Area, potentially increasing fire risk and compounding air quality issues. https://t.co/wsqUFrWUPl

name: sfchronicle
text: Alex Dickerson’s 480-foot blast blast into the upper deck in right field was the longest homer by a Giant since Statcast measurements began in 2015. It also ranked as the second-longest hit in the majors this year, behind a Giancarlo Stanton 483-footer. https://t.co/30Vh0D76B0

name: sfchronicle
text: “Nine times out of 10, the people we’re pouring wine for already know that they hate Petite Sirah,” says Kirkpatrick. “It just seemed so pigeonholed to me. It’s always so intense, so heavy. So I was just curious — is it possible to do something else?” https://t.co/cwCnbNUI9j

name: sfchronicle
text:
#SFGiants’ Dickerson comes tantalizingly close to 4-homer night in rout of Rockies.

Story by @HankSchulman: https://t.co/fOvi2NJhmK

name: sfchronicle
text:
Three people who died inside their Napa home when a lightning-caused wildfire raged through the North Bay were identified by authorities Tuesday.

Story by @pfimrite: https://t.co/lx67JxJpO7

name: sfchronicle
text:
Two female victims were injured in a shooting in Oakland on Tuesday night, police said.

Story by @ByLHernandez: https://t.co/9xvt9WZoIu

name: sfchronicle
text:
The future of California’s water wars, the frustrating crawl toward reopening, and wildfire smoke could linger for months.

Here's what you need to know to start your day: https://t.co/8x5E5XJnsD https://t.co/Bx6oI22Pux

name: sfchronicle
text:
A proposed San Francisco Domestic Work Dignity Council would bring together workers, employers and city representatives to set standards in an industry where wage and labor violations run rampant.

Story by @csaid: https://t.co/5AUivdc38V https://t.co/mkMuJlEP31

name: sfchronicle
text:
President Trump has gone beyond “dog-whistling” to “dog-hollering” about race as he divides the country, says @AshantiGholar, who leads @EmergeAmerica, which recruits and trains Democratic women to run for office.

Listen to our It's All Political podcast: https://t.co/VUf263mRfL

name: sfchronicle
text: Evacuation orders have been lifted for the #CZULightningComplex fires in Santa Cruz County on the east side of Bear Creek. The orders are reduced to evacuation warnings. https://t.co/L8zBL20GyC
